metadata.Title: CVE-2015-0807 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The navigator.sendBeacon implementation in Mozilla Firefox before 37.0, Firefox ESR 31.x before 31.6, and Thunderbird before 31.6 processes HTTP 30x status codes for redirects after a preflight request has occurred, which allows remote attackers to bypass intended CORS access-control checks and conduct cross-site request forgery (CSRF) attacks via a crafted web site, a similar issue to CVE-2014-8638.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-0807` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 37.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 37.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 37.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 37.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:31.6.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:31.6.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:31.6.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:31.6.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-testsuite - 1:31.6.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:31.6.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:31.6.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:31.6.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required
